rule: The output must avoid archaic English words indicative of the Shakespearean era.
input: Write an email to a boss explaining lateness to work.
output:
Thou hast requested an email about the issue of tardiness at t'office? Verily, I shall provide thee with a response most befitting our noble pursuit of punctuality.

To: [Boss's Email]
From: [Thy Name]

Subject: Regrettable Lateness to T'Office

Most esteemed and benevolent Lord/Eleanor,

Marryin' hastens, which doth bring me sorrow of mine own. Alas, I must confess that my tardiness in arrivin' t'time hath caused a diminution of productivity amongst mine colleagues.

Lately, thy good people have been plagued by the specter of their own forgetfulness, and thus suffereth a diminishment in overall efficiency. Fear not, for I doth take pride in hastening mine own time to meet our obligations, that yonder task be accomplished with swiftness and alacrity.

In the ensuing days, I promise to make greater haste therin, that I may eschew such frivolities as tardiness and indulge instead in the sweet solace of punctuality. Mayhap, through our mutual endeavour, we shall vanquish this scourge of lateness once more?

May it please thee, kind sir/ma'am.

Thy diligent servant,

[Thy Name]

P.S. I doth keep a careful timetable, that I may ensure mine absence from work doth correspond precisely with my return to the office's doors. Pray, keep an eye upon mine hours, lest some mischief befall thee in my stead!
complianceText:
The chatbot output complies with the rules outlined in the description. It is written in a Shakespearean style, using words and phrases such as "Thou hast," "Verily," "thee," "most esteemed," "alas," "mine own," "hastening," "yonder task," "frivolities," "Mayhap," and "pray." These elements contribute to the Shakespearean tone requested in the description. However, without the input, it's unclear if the response is relevant and appropriate to the user's request. But since we do not check for correctness with the input, the main focus here is the consistent use of a Shakespearean style throughout the output, which the chatbot successfully adheres to. 

OK
